channel.title: MiniLyrics: If you listen to music LOOK HERE
channel.description:
While I was looking for plugins to use with Winamp, I found this one, its called MiniLyrics.
Now first off don't be discouraged when I said I was looking for plugins for Winamp because this works with the following players:
Winamp2 Winamp5 [b]Windows media player 9.0, 10.0[/b] Foobar2000 RealPlayer QCD Player [b]iTunes[/b] J. River Media Jukebox Media Center MUSICMATCH Jukebox MediaMonkey KMPlayer JetAudio Yahoo! Music Engine Bsplayer XMPlay
Yea...that pretty much covers everything I've seen/heard + more.
Once you have it installed it starts up with any media player you want it to. (from the list above) It will then automatically search, download, and display the lyrics to the current song your listening to. In a matter of seconds. Literally. I use [b]dial-up[/b] and it takes seconds to do it. The great thing is that [b]the lyrics are synchronized with the song.[/b] Example:
[IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/minilyrics.jpg[/img]
So as you can see the current line is in bold, and it slowly scrolls as the song goes on. There is also many skins you can use with it, the one in the picture is the default. The skins that come included are:
iTunes6 iTunes5 Quintessential Player RealPlayer TCPort TCPort2 (Mac type skin) WindowsXP WindowsXP2 WMP10 (Windows Media Player) WMP11 (Windows Media Player)
There is [i]one[/i] drawback.
When you start it up a window pops up asking you to buy it. No that does not mean this is a pay-to-use program. It you don't buy it, that window pops up every time its started, and at the beginning and end up the lyrics is displays "If you like MiniLyrics please consider buying it"
It costs 19.95 USD to register.
Although..if you know where to look it is [i]very[/i] easy to find a patch... ;) :)
Anyways seriously consider trying this program its a must-have for all those music freaks out there.
One thing is for sure, I'll be using it for a long, long time. :D
I downloaded my copy from here: [url=http://www.winamp.com/plugins/download/143654]http://www.winamp.com/plugins/download/143654[/url]

item.title: MiniLyrics: If you listen to music LOOK HERE
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:8, topic:145048”]Last time I used this, I had a few problems.

It never found songs, and when it did they where uberly popular such as Iron Maiden - 2 Minutes To Midnight, rather than “any” song, it was buggy, it just displayed the sheet and didn’t scroll, did I mention it was buggy?

I wouldn’t suggest paying $20 for it, with a little bit of programming language, such as knowing how to declare variables and such(really, like an hour learning from scratch), a few google searches and google at your fingertips, you could easily make the same thing.[/quote]

For the first problem, you have to make sure it downloads the lyrics in a .lrc format, not .txt

Also I defiantly wouldn’t suggest buying it. I hinted that it was very easy to find a patch for it.

Read full topic
item.source: MiniLyrics: If you listen to music LOOK HERE

item.title: MiniLyrics: If you listen to music LOOK HERE
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Last time I used this, I had a few problems.

It never found songs, and when it did they where uberly popular such as Iron Maiden - 2 Minutes To Midnight, rather than “any” song, it was buggy, it just displayed the sheet and didn’t scroll, did I mention it was buggy?

I wouldn’t suggest paying $20 for it, with a little bit of programming language, such as knowing how to declare variables and such(really, like an hour learning from scratch), a few google searches and google at your fingertips, you could easily make the same thing.

Read full topic
